karnak.title: Karnak Temple Complex
karnak.description: The largest temple complex in Egypt, built over 2,000 years. Walk through towering columns and discover ancient Egyptian religious practices.

valleyOfKings.title: Valley of the Kings
valleyOfKings.description: Explore the hidden tombs of pharaohs in this sacred valley. Marvel at the intricate wall paintings and hieroglyphs that have survived for millennia.

abuSimbel.title: Abu Simbel Temples
abuSimbel.description: Ramses II's magnificent temples carved into rock cliffs. Witness the incredible engineering feat that saved these monuments from flooding.

hatshepsut.title: Temple of Hatshepsut
hatshepsut.description: The mortuary temple of Egypt's most successful female pharaoh, built into the cliffs of Deir el-Bahari with stunning architectural design.

felucca.title: Traditional Felucca Sailing
felucca.description: Sail the Nile on traditional wooden boats as ancient Egyptians did. Enjoy peaceful moments watching life along the riverbanks.

nileCruise.title: Luxury Nile Cruise
nileCruise.description: Experience comfort and elegance while cruising between Luxor and Aswan. Watch ancient temples pass by from your floating hotel.

nubianVillage.title: Nubian Village Experience
nubianVillage.description: Visit authentic Nubian communities and learn about their unique culture, colorful houses, and traditional crafts.

luxorSouk.title: Luxor Traditional Market
luxorSouk.description: Browse through bustling markets filled with spices, textiles, and handcrafted souvenirs. Experience authentic Egyptian trading culture.

luxorMuseum.title: Luxor Museum
luxorMuseum.description: Discover a carefully curated collection of artifacts from Theban tombs and temples, showcasing the glory of ancient Luxor.

nubianCrafts.title: Nubian Handicrafts
nubianCrafts.description: Learn traditional Nubian crafting techniques and purchase authentic handmade items directly from local artisans.

luxorResort.title: Luxor Luxury Resort
luxorResort.description: Stay in elegant accommodations with views of the Nile or ancient temples. Enjoy world-class amenities in a historic setting.

aswanHotel.title: Historic Aswan Hotel
aswanHotel.description: Experience the grandeur of colonial-era hospitality in beautifully preserved hotels overlooking the Nile cataracts.

nubianLodge.title: Authentic Nubian Lodge
nubianLodge.description: Stay in traditional Nubian-style accommodations and immerse yourself in local culture and hospitality.

halayeb.title: Halayeb Triangle
halayeb.description: Explore Egypt's southern frontier with unique wildlife, pristine beaches, and unspoiled natural landscapes.

shalateen.title: Shalateen Region
shalateen.description: Discover traditional Bedouin culture and stunning Red Sea coastline in this remote southern area.

luxor.title: Luxor
luxor.description: The world's greatest open-air museum, home to ancient temples and royal tombs.

aswan.title: Aswan
aswan.description: Nubian culture meets ancient history in this picturesque Nile city.

komOmbo.title: Kom Ombo
komOmbo.description: Unique double temple dedicated to two gods, offering stunning Nile views.

cruise.title: Nile Cruise
cruise.description: Experience the magic of the Nile with luxury cruises between Luxor and Aswan.

temples.title: Temple Tours
temples.description: Explore ancient temples and learn about Egypt's fascinating history.

hero.title: Ancient Egypt: Life, Belief & Legacy
hero.subtitle: Step back into the heart of one of history's most remarkable civilizations.

dailyLife.title: A Day in Ancient Egypt
dailyLife.subtitle: Experience the rhythm of daily life in one of history's most sophisticated civilizations

agriculture.title: Agriculture & the Nile
agriculture.description: The annual flooding of the Nile created fertile black soil called 'Kemet' - the Black Land. Farmers used sophisticated irrigation systems and grew wheat, barley, flax, and papyrus.
agriculture.fact: The Nile's flood cycle was so predictable that Egyptians based their calendar on it.

food.title: Food & Drink
food.description: Egyptians enjoyed a varied diet including bread, beer, fish, vegetables, and fruits. Beer was consumed daily by all classes and was safer than water.
food.fact: Workers building the pyramids were paid in bread and beer.

fashion.title: Fashion & Makeup
fashion.description: Both men and women wore makeup, especially kohl around the eyes for protection and beauty. Linen was the primary fabric, with elaborate wigs and jewelry.
fashion.fact: Egyptians invented the first eyeliner and used it for both beauty and sun protection.

society.title: Roles in Society
society.description: Society was hierarchical with the pharaoh at the top, followed by nobles, priests, scribes, craftsmen, and farmers. Women had more rights than in many ancient societies.
society.fact: Women could own property, run businesses, and even become pharaohs like Hatshepsut.

oracle.title: Ancient Oracle
oracle.subtitle: Receive a blessing from the gods

ra.name: Ra
ra.description: The supreme solar deity who sailed across the sky each day in his solar barque.

isis.name: Isis
isis.description: Goddess of magic, motherhood, and fertility. She resurrected Osiris and protected Horus.

osiris.name: Osiris
osiris.description: The first pharaoh who was murdered by Seth but resurrected by Isis to rule the underworld.

anubis.name: Anubis
anubis.description: The jackal-headed god who guided souls to the afterlife and oversaw the weighing of hearts.

horusSeth.title: The Myth of Horus & Seth
horusSeth.description: After Osiris was murdered by his brother Seth, Horus (Osiris's son) fought Seth for 80 years to avenge his father and claim the throne. This epic battle represents the struggle between order and chaos, good and evil.

bookOfDead.title: The Book of the Dead
bookOfDead.description: Not actually a book, but a collection of spells and prayers to help the deceased navigate the afterlife. It included the famous "Weighing of the Heart" ceremony where Anubis judged if one was worthy of eternal life.

innovations.title: Genius of the Ancients
innovations.subtitle: Discover the incredible innovations that shaped the ancient world

medicine.title: Medicine
medicine.description: Egyptian doctors were highly skilled, performing surgeries and using natural remedies.
medicine.fact: They had specialized doctors for different body parts - the first medical specialists!

astronomy.title: Astronomy
astronomy.description: They mapped the stars and created the first solar calendar with 365 days.
astronomy.fact: The Great Pyramid is aligned with incredible precision to true north.

mathematics.title: Mathematics
mathematics.description: Developed geometry for surveying land and building monuments.
mathematics.fact: They calculated pi (π) to a remarkable degree of accuracy.

writing.title: Writing
writing.description: Created hieroglyphs, one of the world's first writing systems.
writing.fact: Hieroglyphs could be read left-to-right, right-to-left, or top-to-bottom!

monuments.title: Timeless Monuments
monuments.subtitle: Marvel at the architectural wonders that have stood the test of time

pyramids.name: The Pyramids of Giza
pyramids.origin: Built as tombs for pharaohs, the Great Pyramid was constructed around 2560 BCE for Khufu.
pyramids.fact: For over 3,800 years, the Great Pyramid was the tallest man-made structure in the world.

valleyOfKings.name: Valley of the Kings
valleyOfKings.origin: Hidden valley where New Kingdom pharaohs were buried to protect their tombs from robbers.
valleyOfKings.fact: Tutankhamun's tomb was the only royal tomb found nearly intact in 1922.
valleyOfKings.details: The valley contains 63 known tombs, though only 26 are royal tombs. The tombs were cut deep into the limestone cliffs and decorated with elaborate paintings and hieroglyphs depicting the journey to the afterlife.

abuSimbel.name: Abu Simbel Temples
abuSimbel.origin: Carved into solid rock by Ramses II, featuring four colossal statues of himself.
abuSimbel.fact: The entire temple complex was moved 200 meters in the 1960s to save it from flooding!
abuSimbel.details: The temples were carved directly into the sandstone cliffs. The main temple features four 20-meter-tall statues of Ramses II. Twice a year, on February 22 and October 22, sunlight penetrates the temple to illuminate the inner sanctuary.

dendera.name: Dendera Temple Complex
dendera.origin: Dedicated to Hathor, goddess of love and joy, with stunning astronomical ceiling.
dendera.fact: The temple's ceiling contains the famous 'Dendera Zodiac' - an ancient star map.
dendera.details: The temple complex covers 40,000 square meters and includes a birth house, sacred lake, and the main temple. The famous Dendera Zodiac ceiling shows the constellations as the ancient Egyptians saw them.

papyrus.fact: Papyrus was used for writing, boats, sandals, and even as food!

mummification.fact: Mummification took 70 days and involved removing organs except the heart.

clocks.fact: Egyptians invented the first clocks using water and shadow measurements.

desertAdventures.title: Desert Adventures in Egypt
desertAdventures.intro: Discover Egypt's majestic deserts through thrilling safaris, serene nights under starry skies, and cultural Bedouin traditions. Whether you seek adrenaline or tranquility, the desert offers unforgettable moments.

safari.title: Desert Safari
safari.description: Experience the thrill of 4x4 adventures across golden dunes, explore fossil valleys, and encounter unique desert wildlife.
items: Fossil Valley and Crystal Mountain excursions
Camel rides through ancient caravan routes

camping.title: Desert Camping
camping.description: Unwind at Bedouin-style camps, enjoy open-air dining, and listen to local stories under the stars.

stargazing.title: Stargazing
stargazing.description: Marvel at the dark skies of the White Desert and Sinai, and discover the ancient Egyptian passion for astronomy.
items: Best viewed from Siwa, Bahariya, and Farafra
Learn about ancient constellations and myths

hero.title: Coptic Sites: A Journey Through Christian Egypt
hero.subtitle: Explore the rich history and cultural heritage of Christian Egypt

introduction.title: Welcome to Christian Egypt
introduction.description: Discover a spiritual heritage that dates back to the dawn of Christianity. Coptic Egypt offers a unique blend of ancient faith, stunning art, and profound history, preserved in its monasteries, churches, and traditions. It's a journey into the heart of one of the world's oldest Christian communities.

tradition.title: Living Tradition
tradition.description: Experience one of the oldest liturgies in the Christian world.

architecture.title: Unique Architecture
architecture.description: Witness a blend of Pharaonic, Greco-Roman, and Islamic styles.

heritage.title: Rich Heritage
heritage.description: Explore sites visited by the Holy Family during their flight into Egypt.

hangingChurch.name: The Hanging Church
hangingChurch.description: One of the oldest churches in Egypt, known for its stunning wooden roof.
hangingChurch.details: Built atop the gatehouse of a Roman fortress, its nave is suspended over a passageway.
hangingChurch.facts: It holds over 100 icons, the oldest dating back to the 8th century.
hangingChurch.visitInfo: Open daily, free entry. Modest dress required.

saintSergius.name: Saints Sergius and Bacchus Church
saintSergius.description: Believed to be built on the spot where the Holy Family rested.
saintSergius.details: The crypt contains the site where the Holy Family is said to have stayed.
saintSergius.facts: It's a major pilgrimage site for Coptic Christians.
saintSergius.visitInfo: Often crowded, especially during religious holidays.

copticMuseum.name: Coptic Museum
copticMuseum.description: Houses the largest collection of Coptic Christian artifacts in the world.
copticMuseum.details: The collection includes icons, textiles, and manuscripts from different eras.
copticMuseum.facts: Its architecture merges Coptic art with traditional Islamic design.
copticMuseum.visitInfo: Entry fee required. Allow at least 2-3 hours for a visit.

saintSimon.name: Saint Simon the Tanner Monastery
saintSimon.description: A huge church complex built into the Mokattam mountain.
saintSimon.details: Also known as the 'Cave Church', it can host up to 20,000 worshippers.
saintSimon.facts: It commemorates the miracle of moving the Mokattam mountain.
saintSimon.visitInfo: Located within the 'Garbage City', a unique community experience.

saintBarbara.name: The Church of Saint Barbara
saintBarbara.description: A beautiful church dedicated to a 4th-century martyr.
saintBarbara.details: Famous for its beautifully inlaid wooden doors and iconostasis.
saintBarbara.facts: It houses the relics of Saint Barbara.
saintBarbara.visitInfo: A quieter alternative to the more crowded nearby churches.

abuSerga.name: Abu Serga
abuSerga.description: One of Egypt's oldest churches, officially known as Saints Sergius and Bacchus Church.
abuSerga.details: Built on the site where the Holy Family is believed to have rested at the end of their journey into Egypt. The crypt is a significant pilgrimage spot.
abuSerga.facts: It's considered a key stop on the Holy Family's trail in Egypt.
abuSerga.visitInfo: The crypt can be accessed, but may have limited visiting hours.

calendar.fact: The Coptic calendar, with 13 months, is one of the oldest in the world and is still used by the church.

hangingChurch.fact: The Hanging Church is so-named because it's built on top of the towers of a Roman fortress.

liturgy.fact: The Coptic liturgy is one of the most ancient Christian services still in use today.

christmas.fact: Coptic Christians celebrate Christmas on January 7th.

saintMark.title: St. Mark arrives in Alexandria
saintMark.description: St. Mark the Evangelist introduces Christianity to Egypt.
impact: Foundation of the Coptic Orthodox Church.
Alexandria becomes a major center of Christian thought.

spread.title: Spread of Christianity
spread.description: Christianity spreads rapidly across Egypt, leading to monasticism.
impact: The Desert Fathers pioneer monastic traditions.

chalcedon.title: Council of Chalcedon
chalcedon.description: A major theological dispute leads to a schism.
impact: The Coptic Church separates from other Christian bodies.
Development of a distinct Coptic identity.

arabConquest.title: Arab Conquest of Egypt
arabConquest.description: Egypt comes under Islamic rule, shaping the Coptic experience.
impact: Copts become a minority in their homeland.
Preservation of Coptic language and culture.

revival.title: Modern Era Revival
revival.description: A period of cultural and spiritual revival for the Coptic community.
impact: Renewed interest in Coptic art and music.
Restoration of ancient churches and monasteries.

dress.title: Dress Modestly
dress.description: Cover shoulders and knees when visiting churches and monasteries.

shoes.title: Comfortable Shoes
shoes.description: Many sites involve walking on uneven stone floors.

respect.title: Respectful Silence
respect.description: These are active places of worship. Be quiet and observe services from a distance.

timing.title: Check Timings
timing.description: Opening hours can vary, especially during holidays like Coptic Christmas or Easter.

photography.title: Photography Rules
photography.description: Ask for permission before taking photos, and avoid using flash.

hero.title: Active Adventures: Sports You Can Do in Egypt
hero.subtitle: From windsurfing the Red Sea to hiking ancient trails in Sinai, Egypt is an outdoor lover's dream. With diverse landscapes and year-round sunshine, it offers unforgettable sports experiences for travelers of all types.

kitesurfing.title: Kitesurfing
kitesurfing.subtitle: Red Sea
kitesurfing.description: Egypt is globally ranked for its ideal kitesurfing conditions. Locations like El Gouna and Ras Sudr offer shallow, calm lagoons and steady wind—perfect for both beginners and pros.

highlights.locations: El Gouna, Soma Bay, Ras Sudr

diving.title: Red Sea Diving
diving.subtitle: Underwater Adventures
diving.description: Dive into world-renowned coral reefs and historic shipwrecks like the Thistlegorm. Egypt's Red Sea offers one of the most biodiverse marine environments on the planet.

highlights.hubs: Diving hubs: Hurghada, Marsa Alam, Dahab

hiking.title: Sinai Hiking
hiking.subtitle: Mountain Trails
hiking.description: Trek the rugged terrain of Sinai. Climb Mount Sinai at dawn or explore off-the-beaten-path trails near St. Catherine. The desert mountains echo with ancient stories.

wadiDegla.title: Wadi Degla Canyon
wadiDegla.subtitle: Urban Wilderness
wadiDegla.description: An urban wilderness in Cairo, Wadi Degla offers a quiet escape for mountain bikers, runners, and nature walkers. It's a favorite weekend spot for locals.

highlights.wildlife: Wildlife spotting in a dry canyon

desertSports.title: Desert Sports
desertSports.subtitle: Sahara Adventures
desertSports.description: Egypt's deserts are playgrounds for the adventurous. Enjoy 4x4 dune bashing, sandboarding down golden slopes, or camping beneath a star-drenched sky.

travelTips.title: Travel Tips
travelTips.timing: Try sports early morning or late afternoon

whereToGoMain.title: Where To Go in Egypt
whereToGoMain.subtitle: Egypt is a land of breathtaking contrasts — from ancient cities to untouched islands, golden deserts to vibrant coastal towns. Discover your next destination.

majorCities.title: Major Cities
majorCities.subtitle: From ancient capitals to modern coastal resorts — explore Egypt's most vibrant urban destinations.

cairo.title: Cairo
cairo.description: The City of a Thousand Minarets stands as the heart of the Arab world, where ancient pyramids meet bustling bazaars. Explore Islamic Cairo's medieval streets, visit world-class museums, and experience the vibrant pulse of modern Egypt's capital.

alexandria.title: Alexandria
alexandria.description: The Pearl of the Mediterranean carries the legacy of ancient scholars and Ptolemaic grandeur. Walk along the Corniche, discover Greco-Roman ruins, and breathe in the cosmopolitan atmosphere of Egypt's second-largest city.

sharmElSheikh.title: Sharm El-Sheikh
sharmElSheikh.description: The jewel of the Sinai Peninsula offers world-class diving, luxury resorts, and stunning Red Sea coral reefs. Gateway to underwater adventures and desert excursions, it's where relaxation meets adventure.

hurghada.title: Hurghada
hurghada.description: A vibrant resort town that has transformed from a fishing village into Egypt's premier Red Sea destination, offering pristine beaches, water sports, and island-hopping adventures.

luxor.title: Luxor
luxor.description: The world's greatest open-air museum, where ancient Thebes reveals its treasures through magnificent temples and royal tombs.

aswan.title: Aswan
aswan.description: The gateway to Nubia, offering tranquil Nile scenery, colorful markets, and authentic Egyptian hospitality.

hiddenIslands.title: Hidden Islands
hiddenIslands.subtitle: Discover Egypt's coastal gems — islands scattered across the Red Sea and Nile River, from coral havens to cultural sanctuaries.

giftunIsland.title: Giftun Island
giftunIsland.description: stands as a pristine coral paradise in the Red Sea, offering some of the world's most spectacular snorkeling and diving experiences. Its protected reefs teem with colorful marine life, while pristine beaches provide the perfect escape from mainland bustle.

tiranIsland.title: Tiran Island
tiranIsland.description: guards the entrance to the Gulf of Aqaba, featuring dramatic underwater walls and vibrant coral gardens that attract diving enthusiasts from around the globe.

elephantineIsland.title: Elephantine Island
elephantineIsland.description: in Aswan holds thousands of years of history, serving as ancient Egypt's southern frontier. Walk among Nubian villages, explore archaeological sites, and experience traditional island life along the legendary Nile.

kitchenerIsland.title: Kitchener's Island
kitchenerIsland.description: (Botanical Island) showcases exotic plants from across Africa and Asia, creating a lush botanical paradise in the heart of the Nile.

naturalEscapes.title: Natural Escapes
naturalEscapes.subtitle: Breathe fresh air in Egypt's most pristine nature escapes — from oases and national parks to sacred mountains.
naturalEscapes.siwa: Siwa Oasis — natural springs, salt lakes, and ancient temples
naturalEscapes.rasMohamed: Ras Mohamed National Park — snorkeling and protected reefs
naturalEscapes.mountSinai: Mount Sinai — hike at dawn for spiritual and scenic beauty

wildSide.title: Walk on the Wild Side
wildSide.subtitle: Lose yourself in nature and discover Egypt's untamed wilderness, where ancient landscapes meet diverse ecosystems.

desertAdventures.title: Desert Adventures
desertAdventures.description: Experience the vastness of the Sahara, camp under starlit skies, and witness the raw beauty of Egypt's desert landscapes.

wildlifeEncounters.title: Wildlife Encounters
wildlifeEncounters.description: From coral reefs teeming with marine life to bird sanctuaries along the Nile, Egypt's wildlife awaits your discovery.

exploreByRegion.title: Explore by Region
exploreByRegion.subtitle: Whether you're heading north to the Mediterranean or deep into the deserts of the west, Egypt has something unique in every direction.

whereToGoCities.subtitle: From ancient capitals steeped in history to modern coastal resorts and cultural treasures along the Nile. Each Egyptian city tells its own unique story of civilization, adventure, and discovery.

historicCapitals.title: Historic Capitals
historicCapitals.subtitle: Ancient seats of power where pharaohs ruled and civilizations flourished, now bustling modern metropolises.

coastalGems.title: Coastal Gems
coastalGems.subtitle: Sun-soaked destinations along Egypt's stunning coastlines, perfect for relaxation and marine adventures.

culturalCapitals.title: Cultural Capitals
culturalCapitals.subtitle: Ancient cities along the Nile where temples stand as monuments to Egypt's glorious past.

common.cairoDescription: The heart of the Arab world where ancient pyramids meet bustling bazaars and medieval Islamic architecture.
common.alexandriaDescription: Egypt's second-largest city carrying the legacy of ancient scholars and Ptolemaic grandeur.

planningAdventure.title: Planning Your Egyptian City Adventure
planningAdventure.description: Each city offers distinct experiences - from Cairo's bustling energy to Dahab's laid-back vibes, from Luxor's ancient wonders to Alexandria's Mediterranean charm.

urbanExploration.title: Urban Exploration
urbanExploration.description: Discover bustling markets, historic neighborhoods, and modern attractions

culturalHeritage.title: Cultural Heritage
culturalHeritage.description: Ancient temples, museums, and archaeological sites tell Egypt's story

localExperiences.title: Local Experiences
localExperiences.description: Traditional cuisine, local crafts, and authentic cultural interactions

edfu.title: Edfu
edfu.subtitle: Temple of Horus
edfu.intro: Edfu stands as one of Egypt's most remarkable archaeological treasures, home to the best-preserved ancient temple in the entire country. This sacred city along the Nile has safeguarded the magnificent Temple of Horus for over 2,000 years, offering visitors an unparalleled glimpse into the religious and architectural mastery of ancient Egypt. The falcon god Horus watches eternally over this timeless sanctuary where hieroglyphic stories still speak across millennia.

history.title: History & Origins
history.content: Built during the Ptolemaic period between 237 and 57 BCE, the Temple of Horus at Edfu represents the pinnacle of ancient Egyptian temple architecture. Constructed over 180 years, it was dedicated to Horus, the falcon-headed god of the sky and divine kingship.

legend.title: The Sacred Legend
legend.content: According to ancient mythology, Edfu was the site of the great battle between Horus and Seth, where good triumphed over evil. The temple walls chronicle this epic struggle through intricate reliefs and hieroglyphic texts, making it a living library of ancient Egyptian religion.

templeOfHorus.title: Temple of Horus
templeOfHorus.description: The most complete ancient temple in Egypt, featuring towering pylons, intricate reliefs, and perfectly preserved hieroglyphic inscriptions that tell the story of ancient Egyptian religion.

greatPylon.title: The Great Pylon
greatPylon.description: Standing 36 meters high, the massive entrance gateway features dramatic reliefs of Ptolemy XII smiting Egypt's enemies before the gods Horus and Hathor.

sanctuary.title: The Sacred Bark Sanctuary
sanctuary.description: The holy of holies where the god's sacred boat was housed, featuring a stunning granite naos that once held the golden statue of Horus.

souq.title: Traditional Souq
souq.description: The local market offers authentic Egyptian crafts, spices, and traditional goods, providing a glimpse into modern Edfu life alongside its ancient heritage.

culture.title: Local Culture
culture.content1: Edfu's people maintain a deep connection to their ancient heritage while living modern Egyptian life. The city's traditional markets offer locally-made pottery, textiles, and agricultural products from the fertile Nile valley. Sweet sugar cane juice and traditional bread from mud-brick ovens remain staples of daily life.
culture.content2: The rhythms of agricultural life still dominate here, with farmers using methods passed down through generations. During religious festivals, the entire community celebrates with traditional music, dance, and feasts that echo the ancient ceremonies once held in the temple. The relationship between the sacred and everyday remains beautifully intertwined in Edfu.

whyVisit.title: Why Visit Edfu?
whyVisit.content: Edfu offers the rare opportunity to step inside a perfectly preserved ancient Egyptian temple and experience the grandeur that ancient worshippers knew. This is where hieroglyphic texts come alive, where ancient rituals can almost be heard echoing through stone corridors, and where the majesty of pharaonic Egypt reveals itself in its most complete form.

whereToGoIslands.title: Egypt's Hidden Islands
whereToGoIslands.subtitle: Discover pristine coastal gems and ancient river sanctuaries scattered across Egypt's waters, from coral paradises in the Red Sea to cultural treasures along the mighty Nile.

redSeaIslands.title: Red Sea Paradise Islands
redSeaIslands.subtitle: Pristine coral reefs, crystal-clear waters, and world-class diving experiences await in the Red Sea's most spectacular islands.

nileIslands.title: Ancient Nile River Islands
nileIslands.subtitle: Step into living history on islands where ancient civilizations flourished and Nubian culture continues to thrive along the eternal Nile.

planningSection.title: Start Your Island Adventure
planningSection.description: Egypt's islands offer some of the most pristine and culturally rich experiences in the country. Whether you're seeking underwater adventures or ancient history, these island escapes provide the perfect blend of natural beauty and cultural significance.

marineExploration.title: Marine Exploration
marineExploration.description: Dive into pristine coral reefs and encounter diverse marine life in protected waters

culturalHeritage.description: Discover ancient civilizations and living traditions on historic Nile islands

naturalBeauty.title: Natural Beauty
naturalBeauty.description: Experience untouched landscapes and crystal-clear waters away from the crowds
